intro: Rubus squalidus, commonly known as the scaly blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the蔷薇科 (Rosaceae) family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems, trifoliate leaves, and small, dark berries that are typically edible. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and woodland areas. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
